instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1286: What is A1286? A1286 is a model number for a 15 inch size MacBook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2009 , Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2255, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2330, 820-2532, 820-2523, 820-2533, 820-2850, 820-2915, 820-3330..

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP Early 2011 - Blue vertical lines appears randomly
threads.message:
while working on this machine i get those stripes that in the pic below, later on if i don't shutdown i get the whole screen blue with thin black stripes like in the other pic below, at first it was happening any time randomly during use as client says, now it happens on boot.
guess i should mention, only windows installed, no mac os for a long time on this mbp.
i think hardware because problem at first appeared randomly and worsened during further use... gpu?.... some other graphic card component? 

if it is actually gpu, should i try get a new one and replace?    

thanks in advance (-:

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP Early 2011 - Blue vertical lines appears randomly
threads.message: Bad GPU. GPUs other than 216-0809000 (6490M) are not available at the moment, only reballed garbage. Do you have a BGA machine and experience?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP Early 2011 - Blue vertical lines appears randomly
threads.message:
[QUOTE="dukefawks, post: 17766"]Bad GPU. GPUs other than 216-0809000 (6490M) are not available at the moment, only reballed garbage. Do you have a BGA machine and experience?[/QUOTE]

No, I don't have a BGA machine...
Most of my experience is on cell boards repair, reballing manually...

Baking GPU with some flux and a blower won't help here?

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1286</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> MBP Early 2011 - Blue vertical lines appears randomly
threads.message: Reballing/reflowing NEVER is a solution for GPUs. Sure it will work again but it will of course die again in a few weeks. Fit a NEW GPU or forget about it.
